item.description:
Full Moon Hike

Thursday, March 8th, 6:00pm – 7:30pm

Ellisville Harbor State Park

Route 3A, Plymouth, MA

Come walk through wooded trails, along the saltwater beach, and on field edges under the light of the full moon.  The March full moon was called the Full Worm Moon by Native Americans.  As the temperature begins to warm and the ground begins to thaw, earthworm casts appear, heralding the return of the robins.  Bring water, wear good hiking shoes, and dress for the weather.  Bring a flashlight, but you may be asked not to use it!  Hike is about 3 miles and appropriate for adults & children 10+.  Rain, snow, or icy trails will cancel.  Space is limited and pre-registration is required.  Please call (508) 866-2580 x161 to pre-register or for more information.  For park information and directions, please visit http://www.mass.gov/dcr/parks/southeast/ells.htm.  

 

(You need to contact the number listed above to register. RSVP'ing here will let other members of the Friends know you are going but will not get you officially registered.)

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Full Moon Hike
